thread.title: Samir Nasri slams Arsenal players as he insists they must take blame for failure… not Arsene Wenger
thread.title_full: Samir Nasri slams Arsenal players as he insists they must take blame for failure… not Arsene Wenger

author: mheathsmith
title: Samir Nasri slams Arsenal players as he insists they must take blame for failure… not Arsene Wenger
text:
4 Samir Nasri is on loan at Sevilla and slammed former club Arsenal 
That made it three defeats in four games – after losses to Watford and Chelsea saw Wenger ’s side plummet TEN points behind the Premier League leaders. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But former Emirates star Nasri , 29, has defended his former boss and slammed Arsenal’s under-performing stars. 
The midfielder, who is currently on loan at Sevilla from Manchester City , said: “You cannot criticise a guy like Wenger – It’s impossible. 
“Arsenal were a big club but he made them even bigger. PA:Press Association Nasri insists former boss Arsene Wenger is not to blame for Arsenal flop Related stories Gunning for Gibbs Danny Welbeck reveals he used to 'hate' Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs when he played against him for Manchester United bren gun Ray Parlour believes Celtic's Brendan Rodgers could be the man to replace Arsene Wenger as Arsenal boss THIERRY HENRY Arsene Wenger must see something in his Arsenal players in training that we don’t SANTI KO Santi Cazorla set to miss rest of the season with ankle injury in huge blow for Arsenal's top-four charge CAREFUL WHAT YOU WISH FOR Arsenal would be unfair to sack Arsene Wenger...'he is a victim of his own success' STAYING PUT Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent Jorge dropping Jorge Sampaoli puts Arsenal and Barcelona on red alert as he delays contract talks with Sevilla something pongs Former Arsenal youngster and 'dench' aficionado Emmanuel Frimpong moves to yet another club 
“I think people need to be fair, it’s not his fault that Arsenal are in the position they are, it’s the players. It’s the players on the pitch that get the results. 
“There are a lot of things happening at Arsenal – the board, the players – they need to be checked, not just Arsene.” 
Nasri spent three seasons at Arsenal before making the controversial switch to City in 2011. 
He won two Prem titles and a League Cup during his time at the Etihad – but admits it would not have been possible without Wenger’s influence. Getty Images Arsenal were totally overrun as they lost 5-1 to Bayern Munich PA:Press Association 4 Fans called for Wenger’s head after Germany humiliation 
Speaking to Sky Sports, he added: “It’s hard for me to say anything about him because I owe him a lot. 
“I came to the Premier League because of him, I had a good career because of him because he gave me confidence and he made me a better player. 
“I think all the players that have played under him, when they leave they become better players so I don’t think it’s him.” Leonardo Jardim admits interest in Premier League amid Arsenal links
